page.title: 14A3 TRUNK ROAD BUTSER
page.content: The first turnpike road in England running from London to Portsmouth is shown in a map circa 1810.In 1839 there were 40 stage coaches every day in either direction stopping at Bottom Inn (the coaching station mentioned in Nicholas Nickleby,now a forestry commission cottage).With the advent of motor traffic,it became the A3 route. To cope with present day traffic a dual_carriage way has been cut through Butser Hill at War Down.This section was opened in 1984. A traffic census taken at mid_day on a Sunday,from a point near Bottom Cottage,recorded 18 vehicles in each direction in 2 minutes.The area is served by two infrequent bus routes between Portsmouth and Petersfield.
